content:
• Thursday, February 14, 2013
  • NVDA

    In spite of the light guidance provided with its FQ4 beat, Nvidia (NVDA +2.9%) finished higher;...

    In spite of the light guidance provided with its FQ4 beat, Nvidia (NVDA +2.9%) finished higher; expectations were low going in thanks to the PC industry's woes. FQ4 Tegra sales +90% Y/Y (year-ago sales were weak) and now 19% of revenue; GPU sales +7% thanks to share gains from AMD. On the earnings call, Nvidia admitted competing in smartphones (against Qualcomm) is tough without an integrated baseband/app processor (expected in 2H), but was more positive about tablets. Needham has cut shares to Hold, citing opex growth and Tegra's challenges.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:15 PM
  • NUS

    Nu-Skin (NYSE:NUS) is active in the post hours session, drafting higher in the wake of...

    Nu-Skin (NYSE:NUS) is active in the post hours session, drafting higher in the wake of Herbalife's (NYSE:HLF) soaring run. Shares +4.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:09 PM | 2 Comments
  • Z

    Zillow (Z +8.6%) finished sharply higher thanks to its Q4 beat and solid guidance, and so did...

    Zillow (Z +8.6%) finished sharply higher thanks to its Q4 beat and solid guidance, and so did Trulia (TRLA +5.2%). Citi (Buy) is pleased with the 90% Y/Y growth seen in Premier Agent revenue (65% of total), and also likes a 47% Y/Y increase in monthly unique users to 34.5M. But the firm is a little worried about Zillow's aggressive spending. On the earnings call, management noted mobile made up over half of January visits, and now accounts for 1/4 of Mortgages revenue. Zillow and Trulia are respectively up 17% and 28% since Tuesday's close thanks to their Q4 reports.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:58 PM
  • QLIK

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: QLIK +14%. HLF +13%. DTLK +12%. TFM +9%. HSP +9%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: QLIK +14%. HLF +13%. DTLK +12%. TFM +9%. HSP +9%.
    After-hours top losers: LOGM -22%. ACTV -10%. A -8%. BGS -7%. ASGN -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • ELLI

    More on Ellie Mae: Q1 guidance is for revenue of $30M-$30.5M and EPS of $0.23-$0.24, above a...

    More on Ellie Mae: Q1 guidance is for revenue of $30M-$30.5M and EPS of $0.23-$0.24, above a consensus of $28.2M and $0.19. 2013 guidance is for revenue of $127.5M-$129M and EPS of $1.06-$1.09, above a consensus of $126.6M and $0.91. Users of Encompass loan origination software +10% Q/Q and +37% Y/Y to 73.7K (up from +30% in Q3); 41.5K are cloud-based. Encompass revenue/user -1% Q/Q and +17% Y/Y to $414. ELLI +8.2% AH. SA contributor Shareholders Unite came to the company's defense last week. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:32 PM
  • CBS

    CBS (NYSE:CBS): Q4 misses across the board on a 2% rise in total revenue. Net profit grew 6.2%...

    CBS (NYSE:CBS): Q4 misses across the board on a 2% rise in total revenue. Net profit grew 6.2% Y/Y however as the media firm saw political and network advertising sales grow. Advertising sales grew 3.4% to $2.42B, driven by higher political and network advertising, while affiliate and subscription fees improved 8.6% on growth at cable networks and higher retransmission revenue. Both helped to offset a 6.5% decine in content-and-licensing revenue. Shares -1.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • PPC

    Pilgrim's Pride (NYSE:PPC): Q4 EPS of $0.09 beats by $0.15. Revenue of $2.19B beats by $240M....

    Pilgrim's Pride (NYSE:PPC): Q4 EPS of $0.09 beats by $0.15. Revenue of $2.19B beats by $240M. Shares +1.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:19 PM
  • BRCD

    More on Brocade Communications (NASDAQ:BRCD): FQ1 beats on all counts as total sales increase 5%...

    More on Brocade Communications (NASDAQ:BRCD): FQ1 beats on all counts as total sales increase 5% Y/Y. Net earnings swung to a loss however, as the manufacturer of data and storage-networking products was hit by a tax charge, though profits improved as storage-business revenue grew 3%, while IP-networking rose by 11%. Gross margin also widened to 63.5% from 61.5%. For the current quarter FQ2 projections bracket Street expectations. Shares -1.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:10 PM
  • TIBX

    Middleware/analytics software provider Tibco (NASDAQ:TIBX) +1.6% AH in response to business...

    Middleware/analytics software provider Tibco (NASDAQ:TIBX) +1.6% AH in response to business intelligence software firm Qlik's Q4 beat and strong 2013 guidance. Both companies have been hyped on occassion as big data plays. Other names that could move higher include Qlik rivals Microstrategy (NASDAQ:MSTR) and Actuate (NASDAQ:BIRT), data warehousing vendors Informatica (NASDAQ:INFA) and Teradata (NYSE:TDC), and machine data software king Splunk (NASDAQ:SPLK).

     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM
  • DTLK

    Datalink (NASDAQ:DTLK): Q4 EPS of $0.31 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $147.3M (+28% Y/Y) beats by...

    Datalink (NASDAQ:DTLK): Q4 EPS of $0.31 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $147.3M (+28% Y/Y) beats by $18.99M. Shares +10.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM
  • PES

    Behind today's massive gains for Pioneer Energy Services (PES +16.2%): The Goldman Sachs report...

    Behind today's massive gains for Pioneer Energy Services (PES +16.2%): The Goldman Sachs report touting an energy sector turnaround also noted several companies screening well via an LBO model. PES came out on top of the list with a theoretical 25% LBO internal rate of return. PES had jumped 13.3% yesterday after Q4 earnings and revenues beat their numbers.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM
  • SAAS

    inContact (NASDAQ:SAAS): Q4 EPS of -$0.01 in-line. Revenue of $30.7M beats by $1.42M. Shares...

    inContact (NASDAQ:SAAS): Q4 EPS of -$0.01 in-line. Revenue of $30.7M beats by $1.42M. Shares +1.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM

    GFI Group (NYSE:GFIG): Q4 EPS of -$0.02 misses by $0.03. GAAP Total Revenue of $207.3M misses by...

    | 4:28 PM

    LogMeIn (NASDAQ:LOGM): Q4 EPS of $0.24 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $37M (+14% Y/Y) beats by $0.27M. Shares -18.8% AH. (PR)

    Brocade Communications (NASDAQ:BRCD): FQ1 EPS of $0.21 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $589M (+5%...

    Brocade Communications (NASDAQ:BRCD): FQ1 EPS of $0.21 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $589M (+5% Y/Y) beats by $14M. (PR) Shares -1.7% AH.

  • BGS

    B&G Foods (NYSE:BGS): Q4 EPS of $0.32 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $173.7M (+15.8% Y/Y)...

    B&G Foods (NYSE:BGS): Q4 EPS of $0.32 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $173.7M (+15.8% Y/Y) misses by $7M. BGS -5.9% AH. (PR)

    Qlik Tech (NASDAQ:QLIK): Q4 EPS of $0.25 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $137.5M (+27% Y/Y) beats by...

    Qlik Tech (NASDAQ:QLIK): Q4 EPS of $0.25 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $137.5M (+27% Y/Y) beats by $10.74M. Shares +12% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • A

    Agilent (NYSE:A): FQ1 EPS of $0.63 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $1.68B (+3% Y/Y) misses by $10M....

    Agilent (NYSE:A): FQ1 EPS of $0.63 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $1.68B (+3% Y/Y) misses by $10M. Expects FQ2 revenue of $1.74B-$1.77B and EPS of $0.64-$0.70, below consensus of $1.79B and $0.74. Shares -8.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • ELLI

    Elli Mae (NYSEMKT:ELLI): Q4 EPS of $0.27 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $29.9M (+60% Y/Y) beats by...

    Elli Mae (NYSEMKT:ELLI): Q4 EPS of $0.27 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $29.9M (+60% Y/Y) beats by $2.12M. Shares +10.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM | 1 Comment
  • HAL

    It's a glorious day for the energy and oil services sectors, powering to the top of the Wall...

    It's a glorious day for the energy and oil services sectors, powering to the top of the Wall Street leaderboard after Goldman Sachs says January marked a "turnaround" in profitability for the group. Among the day's top gainers: HAL +6.2%, NBR +4.3%, SLB +3.7%, HP +3.3%, WFT +2.5%, BHI +2.4%. ETFs: OIH +2.9%, XES +2.9%, XLE +0.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • NSPH

    Nanosphere (NSPH -30%) tanks today after it says that it sees FY13 sales of $13M to $15M, well...

    Nanosphere (NSPH -30%) tanks today after it says that it sees FY13 sales of $13M to $15M, well under analyst expectations for $20.09M in sales this year. The company also said it is evaluating debt facilities to better manage working capital needs. Read more here: Earnings Call Transcript.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 5 Comments
  • VLO

    Valero Energy (VLO +2.2%) says it resumed production this month at its 110M gal./year Albion,...

    Valero Energy (VLO +2.2%) says it resumed production this month at its 110M gal./year Albion, Neb., ethanol plant that had been idled since June due to poor profit margins, as corn basis prices in the area improve. VLO has 10 ethanol plants, eight of which are currently operating; facilities in Linden, Ind. and Bloomingburg, Ohio remain idled because of poor margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM
  • WINT

    Discovery Lab (DSCO +23%) soars after inking a deal with Deerfield Management to provide up to...

    Discovery Lab (DSCO +23%) soars after inking a deal with Deerfield Management to provide up to $30M in debt financing for the biotech company. The new funds will be used to commercialize Surfaxin, which was approved last March by the FDA to treat respiratory distress syndrome in premature infants. Seeking Alpha contributor Larry Smith says the favorable terms of the financing provide a strong catalyst to buy the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM
  • CVE

    Cenovus Energy (CVE -2.4%) will make a strong show of support for TransCanada's (NYSE:TRP) plan...

    Cenovus Energy (CVE -2.4%) will make a strong show of support for TransCanada's (NYSE:TRP) plan to ship oil sands-derived crude to eastern Canada in a converted natural gas pipeline when bids for capacity are called, VP Don Swystun says on a conference call after Q4 earnings, "so we will be having a significant participation when that line goes to open season."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM | 8 Comments
  • TPLM

    In its year-end operational update, Triangle Petroleum (TPLM +1.6%) says it exited FY 2013 Q4...

    In its year-end operational update, Triangle Petroleum (TPLM +1.6%) says it exited FY 2013 Q4 (year ended Jan. 31) with net produced volume of ~3,300 boe/day (2,800 boe/day sold volumes), above the company's guidance. Sees FY 2014 revenues of $269M-$296M and EBITDA of $96M-$114M.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM
  • SPWR

    Even on a very good day for solar stocks (TAN +3.9%), the huge gains posted by SunPower (SPWR...

    Even on a very good day for solar stocks (TAN +3.9%), the huge gains posted by SunPower (SPWR +23.3%) are eye-opening. No news has hit the wires to explain the move, but with 16.9% of the float shorted as of Jan. 31, short-covering could be playing a big role. Solar stocks had already rallied strongly on Monday and Tuesday thanks to growing optimism about an industry bottom. LDK +8.7%. DQ +12.6%. FSLR +7.6%. JASO +5.8%. ENPH +14.3%. WFR +5%. GTAT +5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM | 3 Comments
  • ETR

    Entergy (ETR -2.9%) is downgraded to Sell from Neutral with a $55 price target (from $63) at...

    Entergy (ETR -2.9%) is downgraded to Sell from Neutral with a $55 price target (from $63) at UBS, which sees increasing risks to ETR's regulated segment heading into rate case filings in Louisiana and Arkansas. The firm says management comments that ETR earned "fairly close to or slightly above" allowed ROEs in 2012 suggests downside to its utility estimates.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM
  • PGNX

    Progenics Pharmaceuticals (PGNX +2.2%) reports positive clinical data from a completed Phase 1...

    Progenics Pharmaceuticals (PGNX +2.2%) reports positive clinical data from a completed Phase 1 study of PSMA ADC, an antibody-drug conjugate designed to selectively deliver chemotherapy to cells that express prostate-specific membrane antigen. The tests showed the drug was generally well tolerated in patients at doses up to and including the maximum tolerated dose.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM
  • AAL

    Shares of US Airways (LCC -9.5%) fall off after the company formally announces its merger with...

    Shares of US Airways (LCC -9.5%) fall off after the company formally announces its merger with American Airlines. Though the carriers say annual savings from the marriage will exceed $1B by 2015, some investors want to see a few system complexities and labor integration get worked out before jumping back in.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM
  • GRPN

    Tiger Global still owned nearly 10% of Groupon (GRPN - previous) at the end of Q4, the money...

    Tiger Global still owned nearly 10% of Groupon (GRPN - previous) at the end of Q4, the money manager discloses in its latest 13F. However, Tiger liquidated its sizable positions in LinkedIn (LNKD - 2M shares), Facebook (FB -11.8M shares), and Google (GOOG - 698K shares). A 1M-share position was established in First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR), a 525K-share position in Workday (NYSE:WDAY), a 3.8M-share position in YY (YY +4.5% - spiking higher) , and a 1.5M-share position in Motorola Solutions (NYSE:MSI).

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • AMFW

    Foster Wheeler (FWLT +2%) shares are strong after it signs a five-year agreement with Royal...

    Foster Wheeler (FWLT +2%) shares are strong after it signs a five-year agreement with Royal Dutch Shell (NYSE:RDS.A) to provide support in the preparation of basic engineering packages for Shell technologies, including distillation, hydrocracking, hydrotreating and thermal conversion. Financial terms are not disclosed.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM
  • LUFK

    Lufkin Industries (LUFK +6.3%) shrugs off weak Q1 guidance after its Q4 easily beats across the...

    Lufkin Industries (LUFK +6.3%) shrugs off weak Q1 guidance after its Q4 easily beats across the board. Total revenue rose 27% Y/Y, bouyed by a record year-end backlog of $324M, up 19% year over year. Q1 looks challenging however, as the company faces a back-loaded FY. For the current quarter, it's looking for an EPS of $0.40 - 0.50, versus Street estimates of $0.80. Sales are expected to be around $295M - 305M, below the $330M consensus estimate.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • BB

    BlackBerry (BBRY +5.7%) has erased the morning losses it saw on news ex-chairman/co-CEO Jim...

    BlackBerry (BBRY +5.7%) has erased the morning losses it saw on news ex-chairman/co-CEO Jim Balsillie is no longer a shareholder, and then some. "Who cares?," National Bank's Kris Thompson (previous) responded when asked about the sale. A lot of investors seem to feel the same way.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM | 19 Comments
  • DDD

    3D Systems (DDD -5.8%) spikes lower after Citron Research declares it a "bubble stock" in a new...

    3D Systems (DDD -5.8%) spikes lower after Citron Research declares it a "bubble stock" in a new report (.pdf). The short-seller compares the current hype surrounding 3D printing to the dot.com, real estate, and alternative energy bubbles, criticizes 3D's low R&D spending and aggressive M&A strategy (so have some SA writers), and accuses management of providing a torrent of misleading promotional rhetoric. Also lower: SSYS -6.3%. XONE -2.1%. PRLB -7.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM | 26 Comments
  • AMZN

    Though Goldman Sachs thinks the long-term story on Whole Foods (WFM -9.7%) is still in play even...

    Though Goldman Sachs thinks the long-term story on Whole Foods (WFM -9.7%) is still in play even after the company lowered its estimates for sales growth, the bullish rhetoric is wearing thin on some analysts. SW Retail Advisors' Stacey Widlitz notes that investors don't want to hear about more value deals as a way to drive sales with WFM's P-E ratio still floating around at elevated levels.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • ECA

    Encana (ECA -7.2%) is shaping up as one of the day's biggest losers despite narrowing its net...

    Encana (ECA -7.2%) is shaping up as one of the day's biggest losers despite narrowing its net loss in Q4 as several joint venture partners helped lower production costs, but natural gas production fell 15%. Operating profit rose 28%, as hedging helped realize higher prices for gas. Cash flow fell 18% to $809M. Projects 2013 capex at $3B-$3.2B. Search for a new CEO may take six months.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM
  • VNDA

    Vanda Pharmaceuticals (VNDA +2.4%) moves up after Jefferies raised its rating to Buy on the...

    Vanda Pharmaceuticals (VNDA +2.4%) moves up after Jefferies raised its rating to Buy on the shares earlier today, and ups its price target from $3.50 to $6.00. The firm cites surprisingly good Phase 3 data for Tasimelteon, noting that even the drugs conservatively discounted contribution is likely to have a big upside from current negative EV level.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM
  • CNVR

    Online ad services provider ValueClick (VCLK +17.6%) has skyrocketed to multi-year highs after...

    Online ad services provider ValueClick (VCLK +17.6%) has skyrocketed to multi-year highs after beating Q4 estimates. Management noted on the earnings call its affiliate marketing unit posted 10% Y/Y growth, its highest rate for 2012, and that Europe was "less of a drag" than in recent quarters, thanks in part to a restructuring. Q1 guidance is for revenue of $165M-$168M and EPS of $0.39-$0.41 vs. a consensus of $165.3M and $0.39. Goldman launched coverage with a Buy last week.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM
  • CRY

    CryoLife (CRY +3.2%) moves up after posting mixed Q4 results this morning, beating on its EPS...

    CryoLife (CRY +3.2%) moves up after posting mixed Q4 results this morning, beating on its EPS but coming up shy on revenue. For FY13, it sees revenues between $139M and $143M and its EPS between $0.25 and $0.28. Additionally, its Board approved a $15M stock buyback through October 31, 2014.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM
  • ANRZQ

    Coal stocks (KOL +1.9%) have become much like solar stocks, each reacting to news about a...

    Coal stocks (KOL +1.9%) have become much like solar stocks, each reacting to news about a competitor as it would react if the news was just about itself, Paul Ausick opines; there's money to be made only on volatility, not for the long term. But for today, gains are nearly across the board: ANR +14%, JRCC +7.3%, WLT +4.7%, BTU +4.4%, ACI +3.7%, RNO +3.2%, CNX +1.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM | 4 Comments
  • STZ

    Midday top 10 gainers: STZ +37%. ART +32%. ANGI +24%. EMITF +21%. HNZ +20%. FFEX +20%. MEIP...

    Midday top 10 gainers: STZ +37%. ART +32%. ANGI +24%. EMITF +21%. HNZ +20%. FFEX +20%. MEIP +18%. VCLK +17%. SPWR +17%. DSCO +16%.
    Midday top 10 losers: OTCPK:TBAC -40%. NSPH -31%. END -31%. CTL -22%. WTW -17%. STMP -16%. STRA -11%. ULTA -11%. TCX -11%. ITRI -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM
  • CLDX

    Celldex (CLDX +5.2%) gains today as the company says its final results from its Phase 1 study of...

    Celldex (CLDX +5.2%) gains today as the company says its final results from its Phase 1 study of CDX-301 supports the initiation of a pilot study in hematopoietic stem cell transplantation later this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • GNC

    GNC Holdings (GNC +7.3%) trades higher on bullish guidance in spite of posting a mixed Q4,...

    GNC Holdings (GNC +7.3%) trades higher on bullish guidance in spite of posting a mixed Q4, beating on its bottom line but missing on top line results. The company expects FY13 EPS of $2.75 - $2.80, above the Street view of $2.71, with revenues projected to grow 9% - 10%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM
  • RIG

    A federal judge in New Orleans approves Transocean's (RIG +2.8%) $400M criminal settlement with...

    A federal judge in New Orleans approves Transocean's (RIG +2.8%) $400M criminal settlement with the Justice Department over the 2010 Gulf of Mexico spill, accepting a guilty plea to one criminal misdemeanor violation of the Clean Water Act for failing to properly monitor the well at the time of the blowout.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM
  • MLNX

    EZchip (EZCH +4.4%) rebounds a bit from yesterday's freefall after Oppenheimer upgrades shares...

    EZchip (EZCH +4.4%) rebounds a bit from yesterday's freefall after Oppenheimer upgrades shares to Outperform, arguing the selloff "exaggerates the impact" of lowered guidance. Thanks to Huawei's change of heart, EZchip now sees revenue growing 3x from 2012 levels over the next several years, well below prior guidance. On its earnings call, EZchip talked up the potential of its NPS processor, whose programmability and support for application-level analysis makes it well-suited for software-defined networking. But revenue isn't expected until 2015.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM | 2 Comments
  • T

    Leap Wireless (LEAP +3.5%) jumps to $6.44 after catching an upgrade to Outperform from Wells...

    Leap Wireless (LEAP +3.5%) jumps to $6.44 after catching an upgrade to Outperform from Wells Fargo, which now thinks the company is worth $10-$15/share. Worth to a potential suitor, that is: Leap has been bought and sold based on its M&A prospects for months. 42.4% of the float was shorted as of Jan. 31.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM
  • ANRZQ

    Lower costs and a better than expected cost outlook helped Alpha Natural Resources (ANR +16%)...

    Lower costs and a better than expected cost outlook helped Alpha Natural Resources (ANR +16%) beat forecasts, and CRT Capital looks for more of that recovery in 2014-15, ensuring the cost structure and balance sheet flexibility "to make it through" until coal markets recover. But ANR says the coal market will remain uninspiring until coal inventories drop or gas prices blow through $4.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM
  • DNDN

    Dendreon (DNDN -1.6%) slips after Maxim downgraded the shares to Sell today, citing concerns...

    Dendreon (DNDN -1.6%) slips after Maxim downgraded the shares to Sell today, citing concerns over Provenge sales. The firm also lowers its price target to $4.00.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM | 3 Comments
  • CCL

    Carnival (CCL -1%) slips lower again as the cruise operator's warning on H1 earnings due to its...

    Carnival (CCL -1%) slips lower again as the cruise operator's warning on H1 earnings due to its stranded cruise ship continues to affect sentiment. In the sector, the mishap in the middle of Wave Season is also taking a toll on shares of Royal Caribbean (RCL -0.7%), while Norwegian Cruise Lines (NCLH -0.4%) has ridden out the choppiness in fine fashion to continue its impressive post-IPO run.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM
  • ARUN

    Heavily-shorted Aruba Networks (ARUN +6.9%) jumps following an upgrade to Overweight from Morgan...

    Heavily-shorted Aruba Networks (ARUN +6.9%) jumps following an upgrade to Overweight from Morgan Stanley. A reseller survey indicates stronger growth expectations for Aruba than was the case 3 months ago, and momentum is strong for the company's Instant Wi-Fi access points/controllers and ClearPass management software, with the latter getting a lift from the BYOD trend. Yesterday, archrival Cisco reported 27% Y/Y growth for FQ2 Wireless division sales, though that's a slowdown from FQ1' 38%. Aruba's FQ3 report arrives on Feb. 21. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM
  • UFPI

    Universal Forest Products (UFPI -6%) slides on a disappointing Q4 that missed estimates across...

    Universal Forest Products (UFPI -6%) slides on a disappointing Q4 that missed estimates across the board late yesterday. Net losses widened as the wood-products and construction materials company was hit by higher expenses, masking improved sales across its segments. Gross margin narrowed to 9.4% from 11.2%, as input costs rose 14%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM
  • NOW

    ServiceNow (NOW +7.4%) jumps after receiving a two-notch upgrade to Buy from UBS: the firm cites...

    ServiceNow (NOW +7.4%) jumps after receiving a two-notch upgrade to Buy from UBS: the firm cites valuation, growing adoption of ServiceNow's cloud-based IT service desk platform, and the end of major post-IPO share lockups. Yesterday, SA contributor Max Returns declared ServiceNow a buy for many of the same reasons, and noted the company is taking share from incumbents CA and BMC. A whopping 55.3% of the float was shorted as of Jan. 31. (UBS' October downgrade)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM
